maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet adds a document (JSON) to a MongoDB Collection.
This cmdlet adds a document to the selected MongoDB Collection. You must first select the collection (Get-MongoDBCollection) before a document can be added.
This is a JSON string object. It can be a complex object that is converted to JSON via ConvertTo-Json.
The name of the collection to add the Document to
The name of the MongoDBDatabase to add the Document to
This is a JSON string object. It can be a complex object that is converted to JSON via ConvertTo-Json.
A Collection object to add the Document to
The name of the collection to add the Document to
The name of the MongoDBDatabase to add the Document to
This is a JSON string object. It can be a complex object that is converted to JSON via ConvertTo-Json.
A Collection object to add the Document to

dev:remarks.maml:para: An example showing how to add a simple json document to the collection
An example showing how to add a more complex document to the collection

maml:description.maml:para: Connect to a MongoDB Instance
Connect to a MongoDB Instance
A proper MongoDB connection string
This switch forces the TLS 1.2 Protocol, this is required for Azure CosmosDB with a MongoDB API backend.
A proper MongoDB connection string
This switch forces the TLS 1.2 Protocol, this is required for Azure CosmosDB with a MongoDB API backend.

dev:remarks.maml:para: A simple example showing a connectionstring stored in a variable

maml:description.maml:para: Get a MongoDB Collection
This cmdlet returns a specific MongoDB Collection from the selected MongoDB Database, or all available collections.
This is the database name of the database that holds the collection to return
The name of the collection to retrieve from the Database
This is a database object that holds the collection to return
The name of the collection to retrieve from the Database
This is a string value in the following format
databasename.collectionname
The name of the collection to retrieve from the Database
This is a string value in the following format
databasename.collectionname
This is the database name of the database that holds the collection to return
This is a database object that holds the collection to return

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MongoDBCollection -CollectionName MyCollection
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: How to get a collection by name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MongoDBCollection
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection2 Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a list of collections

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MongoDBCollection -CollectionNamespace 'MyDB.MyCollection'
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: How to get a collection by CollectionNamespace

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MongoDBCollection -CollectionName MyCollection -DatabaseName MyDB
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: How to get a collection using CollectionName and DatabaseName

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $Database| Get-MongoDBCollection -CollectionName MyCollection
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: How to get a collection using a databse on the pipeline

maml:description.maml:para: Get a MongoDB Database
Get a MongoDB Database
The name of the Database to retrieve
The MongoClient to use for a connection
The MongoClient to use for a connection
The name of the Database to retrieve

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MongoDBDatabase -DatabaseName MyDB
Client : MongoDB.Driver.MongoClient DatabaseNamespace : MyDB Settings : GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

command:example.dev:code:

Client : MongoDB.Driver.MongoClient DatabaseNamespace : MyDB2 Settings : GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MongoDBDocument
_id : 4e27b0f5-aaa0-4d4d-bdc8-43f811242d93 Name : FirstName
_id : 1777c473-15fa-44f6-9509-97c3d7847cc1 Name : SecondName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a list of available documents from the collection

maml:description.maml:para: This Cmdlet enables running commands directly against the MongoDB Instance.

This Cmdlet enables running commands directly against the MongoDB Instance. When you run a database command, you specify the command as a document to db.runCommand(). The document's key is the command to run, and the value is typically supplied as 1.
The name of the database to run the command against
A string as a document the document's key is the command to run, and the value is typically supplied as 1.
The Database to run the command against
A string as a document the document's key is the command to run, and the value is typically supplied as 1.
A string as a document the document's key is the command to run, and the value is typically supplied as 1.
The name of the database to run the command against
The Database to run the command against

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example running the dbStats command against a single Database.
Example running the dbStats command against a single Database.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a MongoDB Collection
Create a MongoDB Collection in the selected Database, the collection is only written back to the database when a document is added to it.
The name of the database to create the collection in
The name of the collection to create
A database object to create the collection in
The name of the collection to create
The name of the collection to create
The name of the database to create the collection in
A database object to create the collection in

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-MongoDBCollection -CollectionName MyCollection3
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection3 Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new collection

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-MongoDBCollection -CollectionName MyCollection4 -DatabaseName MyDB
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection4 Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new collection in a different database

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $Database| New-MongoDBCollection -CollectionName MyCollection5
CollectionNamespace : MyDB.MyCollection5 Database : MongoDB.Driver.MongoDatabaseImpl DocumentSerializer : MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.Serializers.BsonDocumentSerializer Indexes : MongoDB.Driver.MongoCollectionImpl`1+MongoIndexManager[MongoDB.Bson.BsonDocument] Settings : AssignIdOnInsert=True;GuidRepresentation=CSharpLegacy;ReadConcern={ };ReadEncoding=null;ReadPreference={ Mode : Primary };WriteConcern={ };WriteEncoding=null

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new collection in the database on the pipeline

command:example.dev:code:
